attributes.action: please examine the feasibility of fining water companies - is this really a cost effective measure when fines are still paid from the public purse ?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Severn Trent has been fined £2m over lies about leaks, AOL today reports.
Britain's second-biggest water company, with eight million consumers, had faced an unlimited fine. Isn't this the irony that the very consumers are themselves
paying the fine. The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to examine the logic of this - balancing out the costs of a court case. Please justify in whose interests the actions of the water regulator Ofwat are : Judge Jeremy Roberts was asked to make an example of the utility provider to deter others. But in a nationalised industry, how can it be that one utility provider has a different precedent to another ? There should be a greater sense of citizenship amongst nationalised industries. All for one and one for all !
